subject: Physical Fitness
title: Flexibility vs Mobility
description: Learn Flexibility vs Mobility in one minute.

hook.text: You can do the splits but can't squat without falling over. Flexible, yes. Mobile? Not quite.

buildup.text: Flexibility is how far a muscle can stretch passively â€” when something pushes it. It's range without control.

discovery.text: Mobility is usable range of motion â€” strength and control through the full stretch. It's active, not passive.

twist.text: A gymnast who can't control her range is injury-prone. Flexibility without strength is dangerous.

climax.text: The goal isn't maximum stretch. It's maximum range you can actually use, control, and strengthen.

punchline.text: Flexibility is range. Mobility is range you own.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between flexibility and mobility?
options: Mobility includes strength and control through the range
